page.title: 01S E Fakenham and Area
page.content: Our block includes the SE quarter of Fakenham and the neighbouring farmland as far as lower Great Ryburgh. In the 1068 Domesday Book the town is entered as Faganham. Today it is a small market town set amid mainly arable farmland. The River Wensum (a trout stream) runs through the town. The population is about 5500. The market (no longer a cattle market) and auction are held on Thursdays. There has been an increase in unemployment since the main printing works closed, although there is some light industry and farm work (including seasonal part time work). Our corner of Fakenham is mainly residential and doesn't cover the town centre. The rest of our block contains the racecourse, 3 farms and part of Great Ryburgh - a small village with a maltings where barley is prepared for brewing.
